text:
I just got caught out by something like
```(v1.5) pkg> dev /path/to/Foo.jl
...
(v1.5) pkg> test Foo
...
ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package SpecialFunctions does not have ChainRulesCore in its dependencies
...

(v1.5) pkg> up
...
(v1.5) pkg> test Foo
...
ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package SpecialFunctions does not have ChainRulesCore in its dependencies```
and it turned out I had a bad manifest in `/path/to/Foo.jl` that wasn’t being re-resolved by up.

Bug? or am I just expecting too much? Should `up` or `resolve` be recursive and also delve-into dev-ed packages?

text: I don't understand the problem, that manifest should not even have been read

elements.text: I don't understand the problem, that manifest should not even have been read

text: Ok. So I think it’s `Distributed` related. Foo uses distributed and that’s where those messages were being thrown
